website_summaries.verdict: Choose this hands-free leash if you like the idea of stowing lots of gear or walking two dogs at a time.
pros: Available in two styles – for walking one or two dogs
Comes with accessory pockets that fit more items than most competing brands, including a phone and water bottle
cons: The downside of the extra pockets is that the belt is a bit bulky when they are full
However, if you have a lot to carry you probably won't mind

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality and very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: This thing withstands the stress of 2 rottweilers and a german shepard at the same time. Two thumbs up for me.
customer_reviews.author: ronald

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for training
customer_reviews.text: This belt is perfect for hands free training! It allows me to take more than 7 dogs at a time all the while my hands are still free which is essential for the people aggressive pack members. Its also incredibly durable and holds a water bottle comfortably!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I am so impressed with this belt- from the second I put it I was instantly satisfied with this purchase. The pockets are great and have dividers in them. The belt it’s self seems durable and has three different rings to clip the leash into. The leash is heavy and stretchy. I took Ghost out for a quick test run and it was so amazing to run hands free. I also like that the leash length is adjustable and the built in handles are a huge bonus. Now we just need a running harness for Ghost. Highly recommend this belt as it holds more than enough gear and is super comfortable :)
customer_reviews.author: Celeste

customer_reviews.title: The leash is really cool too and works well
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the orange item and it is handsome and well made. The leash is really cool too and works well. Very comfortable and not too bulky. The only thing i dont like is that the flat pouch is too flat! I can barely put my fingers in it and a struggle to put things in and out of. The large iphone fits. But barely. I wish i had room like the other pouch. Also the head phone hole is pretty much useless as there is no room. Would be nice to have room and put a poop bag dispenser there instead.
customer_reviews.author: LM

customer_reviews.title: very strong product and very good quality !!
customer_reviews.text: I am super content with this item !! very solid and sturdy material. Every day I walk with my two labradors who weigh about 38 pounds each, and can pull a lot and sometimes very hard. The bags are super handy! without problem I can put my bottle of drink, my cell phone and dog sweets in the matching bag. The three rings are also super handy for carrying my dogpooper, poop bags and the like. For more than 100 percent certainty I recommend this product !!
customer_reviews.author: Maritza E

customer_reviews.title: Durable, handy, can't believe I waited so long to get it
customer_reviews.text: I bought a different belt a few years ago that was terrible and didn't make it past the first run. This belt walks my dogs, client dogs, goes on hikes and runs and is awesome. It securely holds my coffee thermos or a water bottle. My huge phone fits (snugly), it has holes for poo bags, a pocket that fits 2 medium chuckit balls, cards, keys, and I have now permanently attached a bait bag. I hook one dog to each side and even with crazy pulling at times it is comfortable and durable. It is possibly the best dog purchase I have made in a long while.
customer_reviews.author: Molly R

customer_reviews.title: This doesn't actually fit 49" waist
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to start jogging with my dog in the C25K program. I'm not a small girl, my waist is 43" ... and this belt, which is stated to extend to 49" barely closes around the smallest part of my waist. I would say that this would comfortably fit someone who is a 40" waist. It's otherwise a nicely constructed belt, with well thought out leash length/handles, pockets & bottle holder - but I'm giving it 2 stars because it does not fit up to the waist size advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Nifer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I love this!! If for some reason I need 2 hands for something. I put her in a sit/stay then do what I need to do real quick without worrying she's going to take off. Also I love the many pocket I can put treats in. In one I'll put just normal dry dog food. In another I'll put a super yummy treats. In another my ID and such so I don't have to carry my purse. And then we come to the D rings. I love these too. Easy to add a clicker, poo bags, other clips, etc!
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Great for hands free running , walking.
customer_reviews.text: This worked great have a 80lb dog on attached along with my 45lb dog. Only mod I did was purchase a separate Mighty Paw bungee x2 double dog leash and attached the ends to both sides of belt clips then the middle is a free rotating ring I attached the actually dog leash too and worked so much better. when just attached to one side like pictured it would twist belt. Now this works awesome and distributes the force equally to both sides of belt.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L..

customer_reviews.title: Much easier to walk 2 dogs
customer_reviews.text: Feels sturdy. My dogs have put it to the test a few times by unexpectedly yanking in the leash, and I’ve never felt worried it might fall off, even with the strength of two 55lb dogs. It makes cleaning up after the dogs much easier, as I can have both hands free. The bright orange color makes us visible, which is great for night time walks. Only caveat is that for my stronger, more active dog, I actually use carabiners on both ends (to attach to his harness and to the belt) because he somehow manages to Houdini out of typical leash clips. I’ve never tested these ones specifically because of that, so I can’t speak to their quality.
customer_reviews.author: Eva

customer_reviews.title: Too big for a woman’s waist.
customer_reviews.text: I love the thickness of this belt band compared to my old hands-free dog leash. My biggest frustration is that tightened down to the smallest it can go - I could fall out of this, no problem. Which is frustrating if my dog slows down - the belt falls off my waist. I haven’t found a hands-free dog leash that DOESN’T not do this! Very frustrating. With that, this is the best leash I have used so far. Still room for improvement!
customer_reviews.author: ambwilli

customer_reviews.title: Holds a Lot but Leads are Very Springy
customer_reviews.text: I am a smaller woman and even on the smallest size it's a little too big for me. It worked great on my husband though. The leads are good quality and the handles are nice to have but I wouldn't recommend using it in crowded spaces or if your dog isn't good on a leash. With the bungeeness of it, our dogs don't know when to stop pulling because it has such a give to it. It's great for hiking but not so much sidewalk or store use. The wasit pack itself is great though! It holds so much!
customer_reviews.author: Burcham15

customer_reviews.title: This dog walking leash is great not only because it liberates my hands while walking ...
customer_reviews.text: This dog walking leash is great not only because it liberates my hands while walking the two puppies but also my keys, iPhone 6 Plus and other small accessories are well organized and protected even I'm running. The buckle and clip are very strong and I do not think they will break like the other reviews said. I especially like the fact that my water bottle sits securely in the pocket there when I'm running.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas J Myers

customer_reviews.title: Great for jogging, walking, and arthritic hands
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so cool. I have arthritis in my hands and a German Shepherd, so walking was sometimes painful. With this I can let her walk alone if I need a break, pull her in a little if she just needs a reminder or pull her beside me if a distraction is ahead. The handles are padded for comfort, and the belt has a place for my phone, charger, keys, and water bottle. What a great design and so reasonably pric d.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for every activity that involves my pet! Even his training time. I can carry my iPhone X. Water, keys, treats and bags. The only complain I have it isn’t smaller so it could fit my weist better, specially for running purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Yusna

customer_reviews.title: Effective! A must-have for owners with multiple dogs!
customer_reviews.text: Effective and amazing. I have two high energy puppies, both under 1 year, and one of them pulls especially hard whenever walking him. It’s been very difficult to walk them both. This product is a legit game changer!! Not only are my hands free, but both puppies figured out within minutes of walking with the belt, to stay right next to me! It absolutely blew me away. In this video you can see that they both stay close by, I only had to correct Buddy once!!!! This is HUGE!!! Yay!!! I’m so grateful to have this.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn Wallace

customer_reviews.title: I really like the leash as it is flexible enough on its ...
customer_reviews.text: While the belt is a bit bulky, it provides plenty of storage for treats, keys, and ID when just taking a walk. I really like the leash as it is flexible enough on its own with two 'handles' to correct a dog's behavior or keep the dog closer to its human. I tend to reverse the attachment to the belt as shown in the picture because my dog is annoyed with the bulky weight of the handles and it gives him something to try to chew on. This works well when with other humans or dogs are in the area while still providing a little bit of freedom.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Waist Pack!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purchased a dozen or more similar waist belts over two years but always went for cheaper ones - I’m so glad I finally got this! I’ve used it for a few days now and (full time dog walker!) and it’s been a game changer! Great quality, only wish the belt buckle and that area was a bit stronger or more sturdy, but a small flaw in an otherwise wonderful product!
customer_reviews.author: Stefunee?

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, sturdy, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: The belt fits perfectly and is very well made, as is the leash. I was concerned about the "bungee" part of the leash at first, but it is just right in terms of strength and flexibility. The handles on the leash are well placed so it's easy to grab and pull quickly if necessary. I walk a hound dog who does not seem like she would be able to pull me over, but let her charge a squirrel...and she could easily dislocate a shoulder. The waist belt is a lifesaver, especially when I walk two dogs at a time. I am going to buy a second one for a friend for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: yogini

customer_reviews.title: Broke after just 6 weeks
customer_reviews.text: We were walking our 2 dogs and suddenly the leash let the puppy go. He wasn't even tugging on it. Furious. I'm out of money and this junk cost me $40 and now I have to buy another after just 6 weeks. Don't do it.
customer_reviews.author: Ex-Patty

customer_reviews.title: I really like it. Sturdy enough for my 50 lb puppy
customer_reviews.text: User beware: your doggo can trip you with this! Haha, but my puppy is still training to stay at one side of me. I really do love the pockets and 3 clips. I got the water bowls clipped on the side and her on the other. She gets a little too hyped and can pull me but I love the leash and the close handle to control her. When we run together, sometimes the crosses over to the opposite side and yeah almost tripped so keep them on their side. It does feel a little saggy when I'm running but it will with a water bottle in it. It still does a good job, check it out!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: GAME CHANGER
customer_reviews.text: Having two dogs (75lb Doodle & 60lb Lab) that I run with regularly was starting to become a chore using a traditional split lead that I held in my dominate hand. Having to restrain and direct the dogs on occasion, my locomotion while running was thrown completely off and would often result in shoulder pain from only using one hand to control all of their weight. Was extremely excited when this item was delivered today. Immediately impressed with how well the unit was built...then for the run itself...amazing! Was able to use my center of gravity to lead the dogs and run properly. Best money I’ve spent on dog accessories yet.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Strong and versatile
customer_reviews.text: Love all the pockets and many places for the waste bags. Very strong material. Best one I’ve tried. My 80 lbs tank of a dog will sometimes want to bolt and the belt holds without snapping apart. My iPhone X Max fits in one of the pockets. The only thing missing is a lined poo bag (hence 4 stars), so I added one from another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Dog Walker
customer_reviews.text: SO GLAD I got this. I watch many dogs and also have two of my own so this is the perfect way to safely walk them together! With heavier dogs, it did loosen in the waste a bit but it would not open- it’s definitely reinforced well. That was with three dogs on at once, however. Perfect for holding my phone, keys, poop bags- very spacious! I have the iPhone XR and it fits with room to spare. Definitely worth the purchase- I just wish it was easier to buy additional leashes.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssafroh

customer_reviews.title: not what I thought
customer_reviews.text: The product itself seems well made. It doesn't work with my dog (35 pound mixed breed (but strong)...he pulls me down the street if he sees a cat or squirrel and is constantly "wrapping" me in the leash (while switching side to side). I'm 200 pounds and in ok shape. I think it's a good product for a well trained dog that will "heel" on command...that's not my dog. I will use the belt for bags and treats, but not the leash anymore. It would also be nice to have a pouch for a cell phone (I suppose you can adapt the pockets to that use).
customer_reviews.author: Hutch

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, well built, strong, ultimate control over our furry friends.
customer_reviews.text: Those little conniving evil mini Golden Doodles won't escape from me again. Seriously, 2 twenty-five pound dogs ganged up on me and pulled the leash out of my hand, mwahhaha, they'll never do that again. Belt is comfortable and secure, should be able to snowshoe because of length. East to shorten up when negotiating tight spaces or if you need to restrain the dogs from bad habits like jumping on strangers.
customer_reviews.author: nookane

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality materials, well built. Nice padding over any of the hard portions (like the buckles) to prevent rubbing. Can use your own leash or bungee leash provided. I can fit my iPhone Xs, keys, and a few more items in center zipper pouch. The water pouch would hold a standard water bottle. The pouch that is advertised as being for poop bags can hold that plus a bunch of treats.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy T.

customer_reviews.title: Saving my life!
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 small chihuahua mixes and it is such a pain to walk them in an orderly, efficient manner and a pain to walk each separately. This leash is saving my life! I can finally manage all 3 VERY easily! I’m so grateful and excited that we can all finally enjoy long walks together!!! They love it too! HOORAY 😃👏🏼👍🏼
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke after about 30 uses
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 large dogs. I've used this about 20-30 times and the plastic buckle broke under very little pressure. Luckily it broke near my front yard and not near a busy road. If a body harness isn't made for large dogs, then I don't know what it would be for. I would not recommend this product for any size dog. For $40 it should have lasted much longer.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: The best dog walking tool on the planet!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a dog walker that walks from 6 to 12 dogs every day. This belt makes my job so much easier! It keeps everything organized and handy while allowing me to safely connect the dogs to my belt. It was put to the test a few days ago when two pit bull/terrier mixes took off towards a trash truck. The belt held firm keeping the dogs safe! Love this belt! FYI: I use the bottle holder for my large iPhone and it’s perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Racer Girl

customer_reviews.title: Useful, comfortable and light, recommended
customer_reviews.text: I is quite useful, it gives me enough freedom to handle the beast, nevertheless I believe that it might be better if the strap was in the middle instead that to the sides, that might be my only reason for 4 stars It is actually quite useful to have the extra bags there because it allows me to have the bags and some extra water for the beast to drink, I don't want the beast to suffer because I am a running freak.
customer_reviews.author: Mich

customer_reviews.title: Bulky yet light weight
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice hands-free dog walking system. I like that I can hook my dog on my left side, my right side, or directly in the center. My only complaint would be that the waist belt is a bit bulky, although it is lightweight. The placement of the water bottle does not allow for a good run as my arm swing hits the bottle. But it works well for holding phone and keys while out for a run with my dog.
customer_reviews.author: Syddison

customer_reviews.title: Great function and comfort but hooks not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product so was so very disappointed when one of the leash hooks broke today after less than a month of use. Super comfortable, easy to use and the length and bungee on the leash are awesome! Really hope I can find a way to still use it despite the broken hook!
customer_reviews.author: Harmon R&S

customer_reviews.title: Fun when it works!
customer_reviews.text: The buckle that goes on the waist sometimes does not clip all the way if you do not adjust and hear a loud click. There have been a few times where I’ve buckled up and heard a light click and once my dog starts to run the buckle will unpatch and he’ll go sprinting off leash. Otherwise, when it does work it has been very fun to exercise with him. The cord also doubles as an efficient leash with bungee. EDIT: The plastic of the buckle broke and does not work anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Xia

customer_reviews.title: Perfet for long dog walks
customer_reviews.text: I have a large dog and this is very sturdy. I also carry a lot of things with me on walks and we walk a few miles every day. The other one I ordered only had a small pouch so it didn't hold everything and I didn't have enough pockets - this one is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Yes, buy it.
customer_reviews.text: my husband laughed at me when I bought this. We have 3 huskies ages 2 yrs, 8 months, & 7 months. He asked me where I was going to put the first aid kit. Haha in the little pockets of course! All kidding aside, my massive Note 10 phone, treats, poop bags, and portable water bottle/bowl all fit perfectly in this! I was also screwing down subfloor the other day and used just the waist belt part to hold the screws as I moved around-MULTI-USE! Good quality and versatile with or without dogs attached!
customer_reviews.author: Briana

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Very well built and easy on/ off clips. When dogs pull the leads are built to take most of the impact. Nice pockets for poop bags and phones. The bottle holder word for small bottles of watts ( big ones fall out to easy). I have used it several times jogging and took both dogs on a 5 mile trail hike and it made it so much easier hands free.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Practical
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife, who walks dogs of all sizes and types, for Rover.com, to replace a belt that broke (unfastened) a couple of times. The Marksign belt is very sturdy and is easy to adjust. The built-in pouches are perfect for her phone, scoop bags and other stuff. Wish I had bought this for her in the first place. High quality product.
customer_reviews.author: jim corbin

customer_reviews.title: great for rainy days
customer_reviews.text: Got this to use with my new pup and at first I thought it might be overkill, but it is something we will be able to use for a long time! Great for walking in the rain when you have to hold an umbrella or even if you need to take a call. I have also started wearing it with her when we have guests over or even when we are out at a local patio so that I don't have to track her movements so closely. There is a metal loop about halfway down the leash that is also nice for more restricted areas where the longer leash could be problematic. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Barbie K

customer_reviews.title: This leads... me to a 5 star rating
customer_reviews.text: Great for hikes. Let’s upu be hands free and stores so much. It’s comfortable. I will say if you are larger than 40” waist it tops out about there. If you’re handy you could lengthen it by sewing on more of the same fabric which runs about $2-4 at most fabric or craft stores. Fits my hubby with a 36” waist perfectly. Multiple rings to change locations of where your dog is clipped. Water bottle area.
customer_reviews.author: J.L

customer_reviews.title: The cup holder I never knew I needed!
customer_reviews.text: Great handsfree leash I walk three dogs with it one small dog and two large dogs. The only constructive feedback I have is the handle placements are a little strange it would be helpful if all the handles were placed close to the collar like the longer side of the coupler. The cup holder is probably the best thing ever. I take a cup of coffee with me on my walks and this accessory is genius.
customer_reviews.author: Anneka Bath

customer_reviews.title: Great for hikes or runs
customer_reviews.text: Honestly SUCH a good product for the price. I love finding things like this on amazon because i don’t have to go searching store to store to find something that is probably lower quality. 10/10 recommend. Use it for hiking with my dog!
customer_reviews.author: marcus childs

customer_reviews.title: Could use some improvements
customer_reviews.text: I like the leash. The bottle holder on the belt will only hold a small circumference bottle, and since the pocket is not deep the bottle needs to be shorter. The loop for the dog leash is more towards the back, so to have leash on side the belt needs to be turned which puts buckle on side. Its a pain having the pockets in back for treats not convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Sheber

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and durable
customer_reviews.text: I like how sturdy it is and the leash is great. Wish the little pockets were little bigger or easier to access. When I put training treats in with ziplock bag (meat) it is a little hard to access them fast while training.
customer_reviews.author: gosia

customer_reviews.title: Withstands sudden pulls!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs (130 lbs together) are generally good unless they see a duck or raccoon, fox , etc:, but multiple times when they do, this has held up! This is the second one I bought. The cheaper one I had before broke. Get what you pay for, so this is well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: JRW

customer_reviews.title: Zippers Keep Breaking
customer_reviews.text: My wife is a dog trainer, loves these, but goes through them in a couple months by way of the zippers. Keep in mind - heavy, daily, ware and tear. Zippers are plastic/low quality and keep breaking. The Belt itself has a lot of space and multiple hooks on multiple spots on the belt for tethering/carabiners (loose the tether unless you want to confuse your dog). There's better out there.
customer_reviews.author: Trevtar

customer_reviews.title: This is the perfect way for me to have everything I need for ...
customer_reviews.text: I take my dog on hikes and to festivals with me. This is the perfect way for me to have everything I need for him (collapsible bowls, water bottle, poop bags, etc.) with me and still have my hands free. The lead on this have great handles for quick grabbing and I can clip it shorter if I want him a little closer. The stretchiness of the lead is a nice way of warning that my dog is pulling without knocking me on my feet. I has great pockets for my phone, keys and any other little thing you would have on you. I have a 75 lb lab and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works out for my need.
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that the belt has more than one loop to hook the leash onto. The zip pockets are a plus. There’s two things that could use some updating. The bottle holder pocket doesn’t seem to hold bottles well even with the extra elastic bands. The water bottle has fallen out on me often when jogging. The leash doesn’t seem to be well made for dogs over 30 pounds. The leash has two internal bungees built in the leash, and one of my two bungees broke, but the leash is still functional without the second bungee. Great buy for dogs under 30 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you have a big dog it will pull you to your PR lol
customer_reviews.text: My wife got this for her runs with our Newfoundland. Has a little stretch to save you when the pup sees a squirrel or rabbit, but not enough to save you from getting pulled pretty hard. I have used it a couple times and I must say it is nice to have. Plenty of pockets and I hardly notice that i'm wearing it. I run 6:00 to 7:30 ish mile pace and it doesn't hinder me.
customer_reviews.author: dk

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Love it, but I wish the smaller pouch was a little bigger, and perhaps a third pouch. It doesn't help tho, that I carry a treat bag for the dog, another for the crows and carry a large cell phone. So far, with my 50 lb dog it has been fantastic! I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Linda S

customer_reviews.title: Leash came apart while walking two dogs
customer_reviews.text: The stitching near the top handle snapped while I was walking and disconnected my dogs from me, letting them run and clothesline a lady walking her dogs on the other side of the street. It's too bad because the belt is very comfortable and helped my wife be able to control the two dogs at once without hurting her arms.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Soiset

customer_reviews.title: Not strong enough for my 65lbs dog.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the idea of adjustable leash length and that was one of the reasons I purchased it. When I had the leash looped for short length, my 65lbs Lab mix pulled me really hard. The stitches popped out and the looped D-ring came off. Now, I can only use it in the longer position. It’s noted as “For dogs up to 180 lbs”, but it’s not.
customer_reviews.author: GokurakuLemon

customer_reviews.title: hugely great for walking
customer_reviews.text: It has multiple zipper, pockets for treats, toys, phone, and keys, &wallet......hugely great for walking, jogging, biking or just relaxing. It makes me feel soooo convenient &relaxing when I have fun with my doggy.......love it!!! Highly recommended....
customer_reviews.author: Hello Kitty

customer_reviews.title: this should be good
customer_reviews.text: I use a cane need to walk these amazing pups and am looking forward to walking (slowly) with this gizmo
customer_reviews.author: just george

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing product and makes dog walking FUN
customer_reviews.text: After two shoulder surgeries within a year, I was unable to get out and walk my dog. This is an amazing product and makes dog walking FUN. Pockets for everything you need as well as 2 strong D rings to clip things on and a super secure carabiner clip. LOVE THIS!
customer_reviews.author: islander

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t sit well on the hips
customer_reviews.text: I use it to walk dogs and it’s not very comfortable. The material is quite hard which makes it extremely durable but it doesn’t really sit well on the hips.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: I might return this.
customer_reviews.text: I just received it today and was disappointed to find only one regular length leash. The other one is very short (I guess it's a training leash). My dogs won't walk together if I hook the short one to the ring on the long one. I ordered this because it said for walking 2 dogs. I want to be able to hook 2 leashes on each side of the belt.
customer_reviews.author: Shadowbud

customer_reviews.title: Zipper broke.
customer_reviews.text: ****Updated review**** The zipper broke. Purchased March 2019 Zipper broke July 2019-changed to 2 stars I am a dog walker and was very apprehensive about this product. I finally bought it in hopes of relieving shoulder strain. It took a little time for me to get comfortable with it (nothing to do with the product) but now I absolutely LOVE this product! No more shoulder strain! I am extremely happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my daughter to use with her 45 lb. mixed breed rescue. She loves it! It is strong, well-made, and comfortable. Fits her cell phone and all other necessities. I like the bright orange reflective trim.
customer_reviews.author: Sal

customer_reviews.title: The belt has a nice mesh lining and is lightly padded for comfort
customer_reviews.text: This is surprisingly well made. The belt has a nice mesh lining and is lightly padded for comfort. The center zipper pouch is large enough for my iPhone 7 in a Lifeproof case. Not much else will fit in that pouch at the same time. Perhaps my keys. Unlike other reviewers, I had no problem getting a normal plastic one-use water bottle to fit securely and stay.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah B.

customer_reviews.title: Happy customer
customer_reviews.text: I am really glad I made this purchase! It makes walking multiple dogs a lot easier. Plus, it provides a place for your cell phone and poo bags!
customer_reviews.author: gypsywillow

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for controlling my Great Dane
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect to help control my bouncy 7 month old Great Dane, saves my hands shoulders from all the pulling she likes to do, I can control how much leash to give her.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya Lawson

customer_reviews.title: Bad waistband routing
customer_reviews.text: Will update once I have used it longer but disappoint right out of the box. The excess from the adjustable strap is on the inside of the waistband and due to the thickness of the way it is sewn I cant reroute it threw the buckle to put the excess on the out side...so now I have I bunched up excess strap digging into my back.. it could have just been routed on the out side(image putting the extra from your belt on the inside of your belt...) like a normal waist strap
customer_reviews.author: Amanda decker

customer_reviews.title: Hands free
customer_reviews.text: Great for hikes with my big Rott. Comfortable and I don’t have to hold his leash. Hands free comfort and safety. Deer running across the trail, and being charged by an unleashed dog, he stayed safe and under control. If only all people would keep their dogs on a leash.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Use it every walk
customer_reviews.text: I use this every walk I go on, and when I take her out in public! it's easy to use, it stays in one place, and you can clip the dog to either. side, or two dogs ( though I had two pullers so it was kinda difficult, but it helped me anchor myself so they didn't pull me over) the pockets are great. I turned the headphone spot into a poop bag dispenser, ( just cut it a tiny bit)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yup - great!
customer_reviews.text: Dog trainer recommended using this while biking - wow Use it everyday I adore Also like that the leash is a hook so you can find another leash if need be (versus some packs are made with one snap plastic end versus this one with two metal ends)
customer_reviews.author: MegaMaper

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: My daughter wanted it for walking our pit mix. Although she's trained (the dog) she "forgets". Anyway daughter says it takes a lot of the strain off of both of them. five stars for us. plus doggie bags and phone have a place to rest besides in your hand.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Q.

customer_reviews.title: Great leash, okay belt
customer_reviews.text: The leash works great. I love the pockets on the belt but it would be better if the pockets and such could be behind you and the hooks were on the opposite side. Design as it is makes the straps pull into you when your dog pulls on you, instead of wider more comfortable part against your body.
customer_reviews.author: Disneydoc

customer_reviews.title: great so far
customer_reviews.text: everything is perfect just waiting a week or so to give that last star after my 80 pound pit has been using it a little while but he has not been pulling with new tactical harness and new bungee strap leash when he feels it stretch the bungee cord he stops and looks back at us and comes back so far LOVING IT
customer_reviews.author: cord cutting rookie

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I love this belt so much. It’s extremely convenient and well made. I’ve had it for over a month and use it all the time! Very versatile and love the compartments. The only thing I would suggest fixing is the larger compartment that allows dog bags in doesn’t work super well - the roll doesn’t have the proper angle to roll out correctly so it gets caught a lot. Other than that, we love it!
customer_reviews.author: Joni Starry

customer_reviews.title: Love this product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! I put one dog on each side and It is so much easier to control them. I wish I knew about this product when they were puppies. Training would have been so much more comfortable than having the leash around my wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Jo R.

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: Broke the first week. Leash expands which allows no control. Dog gets twisted and trips you! The belt part falls down. Doesn’t stay in place. I would rather just hold a good quality leash than be hands free with this thing
customer_reviews.author: whitney hampton

customer_reviews.title: plastic fastener broke when trying to clip it around my waist
customer_reviews.text: Like the lead but cell fone wont fit in the pouch with the otter box on it...too small and clip broke when trying to fasten the belt with pockets around my waist. I can't use it, what a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Darlene Orangias

customer_reviews.title: Super convenient!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! My dogs pull and are still in training so this is very nice with the bungee leashes. Could use padding all the way around, but otherwise works perfectly- I would say that it’s not super heavy duty but also not chinsey. All in all worth the price!!
customer_reviews.author: Autumn

customer_reviews.title: Love how the pack feels around the waist
customer_reviews.text: Love how the pack feels around the waist, it's very comfortable and adjustable. However, in less then 48 hours the me second D ring on the bunggy leash flew off. We weren't even walking it happened when I hooked the lease to the belt and he jumped out of the car. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Zanes

customer_reviews.title: Everything I expected!!
customer_reviews.text: I use this everyday! I walk dogs for a living and it’s really nice to have two rings to connect the leashes to leaving my hands free to take pictures of my pups to show their owners. I love that the treat pocket seems to conceal the smell from my pup clients and I can fit my iPhone X in the front pocket along with some report cards, 2 rolls of poo bags and checks clients write.
customer_reviews.author: Siovhan

customer_reviews.title: Most Durable Dog Training Belt!
customer_reviews.text: The pockets can hold everything I need to go on a walk. The leash is made of an elastic cord which makes pulling or any sudden changes feel less abrupt for both me and my dog. I wish the leash felt a little stronger though. I ended up replacing the cord with another one. My husky is a strong puller but this belt has held up. The water bottle holder ripped but it still usable. Besides that, I am very happy with this multifunctional belt.
customer_reviews.author: VB

customer_reviews.title: Great design but terrible sizing
customer_reviews.text: Love the idea and design but it does not get small enough. I’ll add a picture of how I have to wear it to make it work
customer_reviews.author: ace717

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal waist leash design
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for 2 strong Pitbulls that love the world outside. I’m post op for a second shoulder surgery so this was a must. I was using a thin waist leash for years and it was causing hip pain. I wear this as a fanny pack with no discomfort. No more tangling of the leashes either! I’m a dog trainer and will recommend to people with multiple dogs for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Sandi Vesay

customer_reviews.title: great for walking 2 dogs
customer_reviews.text: works well .... great for walking 2 dogs .... my dogs are both under 20 lbs ... leash is a bit clunky for my taste so I use a smaller leash ... wish the very small bottle holder could be removed ... all and all a good product ...
customer_reviews.author: thomas coravos

customer_reviews.title: Really like this set up
customer_reviews.text: Walking three dogs with handheld leashes got old. This is convenient and practical. One of my dogs is 40 pounds. Upon seeing a wild animal, she lunged at it. The bungee-cord style leash did not torque my back. I walk with two dogs on this leash (on my left) and a third dog on the right side on a similar leash. Really like this set up.
customer_reviews.author: roscoe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I really like this. It has relieved so much pressure of my shoulders and neck. I use this to walk a 60 pound pit mix who is very strong. I love the pockets and water bottle holder. It's a nice product and I'm glad I purchased it.

customer_reviews.title: Control and convenience !
customer_reviews.text: Love the convenience of being able to walk both my dogs and drink my morning coffee. Great for training dogs to walk with the treat pouch. Durable and the bungees absorb majority of the pull from the dogs. The leashes are the perfect length with grip handles to hold them closer if needed. Have done nothing but rave about this product to my other dog mom friends.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: works up to size 42” yea if I gain a pound I’m toast
customer_reviews.text: I really like the big front pockets ,3 D rings lol small water bottle, and I have two large Scottish Terriers , that pull 😳 I get to use two walking sticks 😃👍🎅
customer_reviews.author: BOSSA

customer_reviews.title: The perfect leash
customer_reviews.text: Get this now! Great for trained and untrained dogs alike but ideal FOR training. No more pulling your arm out of socket, fingers pinched or getting away. Adjusts to fit any member of the family, and I'm a big guy with small daughters. A simple adjustment and any of us can wear it. Great for those areas where they have to be on a leash but you have stuff to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald L Horne

customer_reviews.title: Handles more than 2 dogs.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect, attach 3 dogs, they do not get tangled. Am Staf, mini schnauzer, long haired doxie.
customer_reviews.author: Lynda K McAdams

customer_reviews.title: This is awesome if you walk the dog.
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome. I even made it better by buying two 18" leads to one on each side and bring the two handles together in the front for a straighter control of our dog. We hike the white mountains with a 30' leash. we will be doing Mt. Washington in a week or two. I wish I found it earlier.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce A. Slabinski

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable system- love the elastic!
customer_reviews.text: Just took my dog for a five mile walk and the leash performed great! Zipper pouch for treats, a spot to put a 16oz water bottle, and pouch for your cell phone.
customer_reviews.author: Reid

customer_reviews.title: Husband LOVES it!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this leash! He has a lot of pain in his shoulders and this allows him to comfortable walk the dog while swinging his arms (rather than holding the leash). He also likes the width of the belt around his waist.
customer_reviews.author: T Ferrin

customer_reviews.title: Works perfecr
customer_reviews.text: Love this!!! Makes walking my dogs so much easier because do have my hands free.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Bird

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Best leash for 2 dogs! Great product. Now I just need to find 2 dogs to walk!
customer_reviews.author: Sigmax

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size and quality.
customer_reviews.text: We loved. Is comfortable and convenient for our dogs. It's the perfect size end good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Edyta

customer_reviews.title: Must Buy!!
customer_reviews.text: OMG I LOVE THIS PRODUCT! My LO, my boxer, and I go out every morning with the belt! I love having my hands free and the leash is awesome with easy handles to control my pup quickly! Must buy if you like taking your pup on walk with your hands free, a compartment for your phone, a special place for treats and poop bags, and a bottle of water!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: Best thing since sliced bread! Works well with120 pound Malamute.
customer_reviews.author: t-10-charlie

customer_reviews.title: Extremely sturdy. Clips felt durable and the pockets/attached bags felt ...
customer_reviews.text: Extremely sturdy. Clips felt durable and the pockets/attached bags felt substantial. Strong enough to withstand my 85-lb Golden Retreiver and a 65 lb Boxer pulling and yanking on it whenever they saw a squirrel. The water pouch comes with elastic to keep the water bottles stabilized. The belt was comfortable enough for me to jog with my dogs. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Daria Gaillard

customer_reviews.title: Versatile
customer_reviews.text: I love this belt! I’m a dog walker and it’s amazing! I use it on my own two Shiba Inus as well and it works great!
customer_reviews.author: N. Sell

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: i have two dogs and i bough two of these (one for me, one for bf). hands free is the way to go and this has lots of pockets. i look nerdy but it's worth it to not have to hold a leash.
customer_reviews.author: gabrielle geiger

customer_reviews.title: Great hands free leash
customer_reviews.text: So glad I bought this hands free leash, it is great. Really like the bungee parts because it gives enough resistance to dog without it feeling like you are going to get pulled and dragged.
customer_reviews.author: JMA

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Great for walking the dog and pushing a stroller at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Twinnie

customer_reviews.title: Well Made
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy option for hands free dog walking. I have a 50 lb lab and he & are are enjoying the quality of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Huff 13

product_meta.title: FURRY BUDDY Hands Free Dog Leash, Dog Walking Training Belt Shock Absorbing Bungee Leash up to 180lbs Large Dogs, Phone Pocket Water Bottle Holder, Fits All Waist Sizes from 28” to 48”
feature_bullets: Adjustable buckle and strap design fits most waist sizes from 28” to 48”，Inner pocket for keys, cards and other small accessories. Elastic strap fixed water bottle holder.
3 heavy duty D rings connect to a heavy duty bungee dog leash with reflective stitching. Leash length is flexible from 39” to 53.5”
Made of super strong neoprene fabric and breathable padded mesh liner. Reflective stripes enhance safety while you are running or walking.

Waterproof zippered main pocket large enough for most smart phones. Waterproof zippered treat pouch included. Waterproof zippered main pocket large enough for most smart phones. Waterproof zippered treat pouch included.

3 Year Guarantee: All of our products come with a 3-Year No Questions Asked Warranty. If you are at all unsatisfied with your product, please contact us (through Amazon if past the standard return window) and we will be happy to assist you.
